title: Win a Hoy Shizuoka Bike and VIP Revolution tickets
text: With the Rugby World Cup in full swing and Round 2 of the Revolution Series kicking off in October, we’ve got some great sport upon us. To celebrate, the Telegraph has teamed up with the Revolution Series and Hoy bikes to give away a Hoy Shizuoka Hybrid Bike and 2 VIP Revolution tickets. The Revolution Series is the UK’s biggest elite track cycling league. It has featured some of the world’s biggest names in cycling, and sometimes even rugby stars. In 2003, a former England rugby captain donned the Lycra and raced in a special Italian pursuit in front of a sell-out crowd. The Revolution Series Twelve elite teams will compete in the Revolution Elite Championship for points across the five-round series. This season Team Wiggins make their debut in the competition, taking on defending champions Maloja Pushbikers as well as JLT-Condor and Team Sky. 2015 Revolution Series event dates: 24 October: National Cycling Centre, Manchester 14 November: Lee Valley VeloPark, London 28 November: Sir Chris Hoy Velodrome, Glasgow 2 January 2016: National Cycling Centre, Manchester 23 January: National Cycling Centre, Manchester Photo: Adam Tranter @ Fusion Media For a chance to win a pair of VIP tickets to one of these events plus a fantastic Hoy Shizuoka bike (worth £500), all you need to do is guess the name of the former England rugby captain pictured racing above and enter your details in the form below by midnight on 4 November 2015.
